mdRecord.dcterms:title: Passaic County Courthouse Annex, general view
Old Paterson Post Office

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Passaic County Courthouse Annex was originally the U.S. Post Office for Paterson, N.J. Completed in1898 or 1899, it was designed in Flemish style, modeled on the Haarlem Market in Holland, as a tribute to the Dutch settlers of the area. The building remained a post office until 1932. In 1937 it was repurposed as the Passaic County Court House. Schtiller and Plevy performed a major restoration in 2004 [?]. [work]
